summary: This module is a benchmarking tool that compares the performance of strcasecmp() and sm_strcasecmp() functions. It runs a series of tests with different string inputs and reports the execution time for each function, helping developers determine which implementation is more efficient.

logs.message_template:
This program benchmarks the performance differences between
strcasecmp() and sm_strcasecmp().
These tests may take several minutes to complete.
logs.reason: Informs the user about the purpose of the program and sets expectations about runtime duration

logs.message_template: If you want to run it, specify -d as option.
logs.reason: Instructs the user on how to properly run the benchmark when they haven't provided the required -d option
logs.resolution: User should rerun the program with the -d command line option

logs.reason: Announces the start of a specific benchmark test case, showing which strings are being compared
Reports the execution time and result of the strcasecmp() function for the current test case
Reports the execution time and result of the sm_strcasecmp() function for the current test case
Indicates that the performance difference between the two functions is too small to make a clear recommendation
logs.resolution: Consider running the benchmark on different hardware or with different compiler optimization settings

logs.message_template: ** results too close redoing test %ld times **
logs.reason: Announces that the benchmark is increasing the number of iterations to get more reliable results due to small time differences

logs.message_template:
Interpreting the results:
	For differences larger than 2 seconds, the lower value is
	better and that function should be used for performance
	reasons.

This program will re-run the tests when the difference is
less than 2 seconds.
The result will vary depending on the compiler optimization
level used. Compiling the sendmail libsm library with a
better optimization level can change the results.
logs.reason: Provides guidance on how to interpret the benchmark results and explains the methodology
logs.resolution: Consider the benchmark results when deciding which function to use in performance-critical code

logs.reason: Reports a system error that occurred when calling the gettimeofday() function, causing the benchmark to fail
logs.resolution: Check for system resource constraints or issues with the system clock. May indicate problems with the operating system's time services.
